class.name: System.Diagnostics.TraceListener
class.summary: Provides the abstract base class for the listeners who monitor trace and debug output.

constructor.name: TraceListener
constructor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceListener class.

constructor.name: TraceListener(System.String)
constructor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceListener class using the specified name as the listener.

property.name: IndentLevel
property.summary: Gets or sets the indent level.
property.value: The indent level. The default is zero.

property.name: IndentSize
property.summary: Gets or sets the number of spaces in an indent.
property.value: The number of spaces in an indent. The default is four spaces.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Gets or sets a name for this TraceListener.
property.value: A name for this TraceListener. The default is the empty string ("").

property.name: NeedIndent
property.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to indent the output.
property.value: true if the output should be indented; otherwise false.

method.name: Dispose
method.summary: Releases all resources used by the i TraceListener.

method.name: WriteIndent
method.summary: Writes the indent to the listener you create when you implement this class, and resets the NeedIndent Property to false.

method.name: WriteLine(System.String, System.String)
method.summary: Writes a category name and a message to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class, followed by a line terminator.
method.param: A category name used to organize the output.

method.name: WriteLine(System.Object, System.String)
method.summary: Writes a category name and the value of the object's ToString method to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class, followed by a line terminator.
method.param: An Object whose fully qualified class name you wish to write.
A category name used to organize the output.

method.name: WriteLine(System.String)
method.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the specified message to the listener you create in the derived class, followed by a line terminator.

method.name: WriteLine(System.Object)
method.summary: Writes the value of the object's ToString method to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class, followed by a line terminator.
method.param: An Object whose fully qualified class name you want to write.

method.name: Write(System.String, System.String)
method.summary: Writes a category name and a message to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class.
method.param: A category name used to organize the output.

method.name: Write(System.Object, System.String)
method.summary: Writes a category name and the value of the object's ToString method to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class.
method.param: An Object whose fully qualified class name you wish to write.
A category name used to organize the output.

method.name: Write(System.String)
method.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the specified message to the listener you create in the derived class.

method.name: Write(System.Object)
method.summary: Writes the value of the object's ToString method to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class.
method.param: An Object whose fully qualified class name you want to write.

method.name: Flush
method.summary: When overridden in a derived class, flushes the output buffer.

method.name: Fail(System.String, System.String)
method.summary: Emits an error message, and a detailed error message to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class.

method.name: Fail(System.String)
method.summary: Emits an error message to the listener you create when you implement the TraceListener class.

method.name: Close
method.summary: When overridden in a derived class, closes the output stream so it no longer receives tracing or debugging output.
